protected_spaces_details.description: Outdoor sports facilities incl school playing fields

description: Remodelling of existing landscape to create formal and informal public open space including mounding (by use of imported material), fishing lakes, water features and gardens, sport and play provision, meadows, open air events space, visitors centre, and two car parking areas (with access off "slip road" onto Western Avenue, and access off Kensington Road) (Environmental Impact Assessment Application) (Application for Deemed Consent by London Borough of Ealing) (Revised Application)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Details of the visitors centre and amphitheatre shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before development of these elements commences, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the design is of a high quality commensurate with the site's location and its surroundings, in accordance with adopted policies B1 and B5 and replacement UDP policy 4.1. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the visitors centre and amphitheatre shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of these developments is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | Development shall not begin until details of drainage works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority; the scheme as approved shall be carried out before any part of the development permitted is occupied.  REASON: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with Adopted and RUDP policies R10 and 2.5. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of refuse storage and waste management programme for the development hereby permitted in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision as approved shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of each phase of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:  To ensure adequate refuse storage and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies H34, 4.1 and 5. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment, and internal gates/fences to be erected.  The boundary treatment and internal gates/fences shall be completed in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained.  REASON:  To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies B1, B2 and RUDP policies 4.1 and 4.5 | Full details of both hard and soft landscaping works (including tree planting) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with adopted UDP polices B2 and ES4 and Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | A schedule of Landscape management for a minimum period of 5 years shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to planting of landscaping.  Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON:  To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies B2, ES4 and RUDP policies 4.5. | Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, must be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the construction phase and use of the site and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties surrounding the site in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of vehicular access, new vehicular and pedestrian accesses, traffic control/management system, and programme for implementation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  Such details as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and thereafter permanently retained.    REASON: In the interests of highway safety, and to protect living conditions of occupiers in the surrounding area and the character and appearance of the surrounding area, in accrdance with Adopted and Replacement UDP policies T62 and 9.1, 9.5. | Notwithstanding details shown on the submitted plans, details of the visibility splays at locations of potential conflict between vehicles and pedestrians shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the development, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the relevant phase, and retained permanently.   REASON: In the interest of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with Adopted and RUDP policies  T62, 9.5 and 9.1 | No development shall take place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme  of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme for investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the Local Planing Authority  Reason: to safeguard the special archaeological interest of the site in accordance with Adopted and RUDP policies 4.9 10.13 | Details of the design of the building and car/cycle and parking area, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured By Design and Secured Car Parks award shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B20; Replacement Plan policies 4.3 & 4.4. and Supplementary guidance "Safer Ealing". | Details of a demolition and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  REASON:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B5, B9, 4.1. | Surface water drainage works shall be carried out in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before development commences.  REASON:  To prevent the increased risk of flooding and to prevent pollution of the water environment , in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies R10, R11,2.5. | Surface water source control measures shall be carried out in  accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before development commences.  REASON: To prevent the increased risk of flooding and to improve water quality, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies R10, R11,2.5. | Any proposed water features shall be constructed in accordance with details which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences.   REASON: To ensure that those features enhance the conservation value of the site and provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife using the waterbody. , in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies R11, 2.5,3.8,3.9 | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods that shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and all works, including remedial works, shall be implemented as approved before any other works commence.   REASON: To ensure the safety of the site in accordance adopted and replacement UDP policies 2.7and R16 | Notwithstanding any information contained in the submitted applications or on the submitted drawings, prior to any development commencing details of pedestrian and vehicular access to and within the site, numbers, location and layout of proposed car parking and cycle parking and cycle parking spaces shall be submitted in writing for the approval of the Local Planning Authority. Such details as approved shall be constructed before commencement of the development and permanently retained  Reason: To ensure adequate and safe facilities are provided, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the amount of car parking on the site, in accordance with adopted RUDP Policies 91, 9.6, 9.7, 9.9 and 9.11. | The existing temporary crossover shall be permanently closed and the footway reinstated to the Satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development hereby permitted is bought into use.  REASON: In the interest of highway safety and the amenity of the locality, in accordance with Adopted UDP policies and RUDP policies B5, T32, T40 and 9.1 | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before development of the visitors centre is commenced, to demonstrate that the composite sound reduction index of the building envelope, Rw, will achieve the following criteria with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided:  - The background L90,15min linear noise level in any one third octave band from 50Hz to 160 Hz, and also the overall Linear L90 level, as previously measured at 1 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected premises, shall not be increased when the amplified music or speech is played and the measurement is repeated in the same position using L90 linear over any 5 minute period with the background and source operating together.  The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding area in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development of the visitors centre is commenced, for a suitable mechanical ventilation system, to ensure doors and windows are kept closed during hot weather and externally sited ventilation plant associated with this system will be silenced to a standard not exceeding NR 35 Leq,5min (2300 - 0700hrs), measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding area in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development of the visitors centre and amphitheatre is commenced, for a suitable sound limiting device to control the output from the amplification system to a maximum noise level agreed with this the Authority.  The limiter device shall also be connected to all external doors so that the power to the amplifiers will be cut if a door is opened, other than for means of escape from fire. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding area in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development of the visitors centre is commenced, to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding: - NR35 Leq,5mins, for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. - NR40 Leq,1hr for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding area in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for a noise barrier along the south eastern boundary of the sports pitch before the development of the sports pitch is commenced.  The works shall be completed first use of the pitch and permanently retained thereafter. The following criteria shall be met:  LAmax,1hr noise level for pitch noise shall not to exceed the following criteria:-  - 60 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected dwelling during the period 2300 to 0700 hrs, where less than 15 noise events are predicted for the period.   - 55 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected dwelling during the period 2300 to 0700 hrs, where greater than 15 noise events are predicted during the period.  - 65 dBA at 3.5 m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected dwelling during the period 0700 to 2300 hrs.  Barriers shall be manufactured and constructed to the Authority's specifications as specified at Document 5.3, "Guidance for developers".  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding areas in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | No deliveries from HGV's shall be made to the site from Kensington Road and deliveries that are to be made shall only be from the A40 slip Road and outside peak (hours of 7.30am -9.00am)   REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers surrounding the site in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | No development shall take place until details of earthworks have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include the proposed grading and mounding of land areas including the levels and contours to be formed, showing the relationship of proposed mounding to existing vegetation and surrounding landform. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.   REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with adopted UDP polices B2 and ES4 and Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | A soil survey of imported material shall be undertaken and the results provided to the local planning authority. If contamination is to be found a scheme for decontamination shall then be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing and the scheme as approved shall be fully implemented and completed before any further construction work is undertaken.   REASON: To ensure the safety of the site in accordance of with adopted and replacement UDP policies 2.7 and | A scheme incorporating a risk management assessment for the potential for bird strikes shall be submitted to and agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority before the development hereby approved is commenced. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON: To mitigate the potential for bird strikes in accordance with adopted and replacement plan policies 3.9 and OL22 | No development shall take place until an Ecological Survey of the whole site has been conducted and the findings of the survey shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and any recommendations shall be implemented in accordance with the findings.  REASO: To protect the flora and fauna and ecological value of the site in accordance with adopted and replacement plan policies  3.8, 3.9 and OL19, OL21, OL24. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and the scheme as approved shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, ES3; Replacement Plan policies 4.1, 4.3.
